lines.text: The next time I have a daughter, I hope it's a boy!
I must be the prized dope of all-time... thinking I could pry you away from your mama's ever-lovin' tentacles.

[singing]
Oh one last kiss... there never was such bliss... I love your dentifrice!
Well we could sure use the money. Any day now we'll have another mouth to feed.
Rosie, you're not even married.
His mother!
Goodbye, Rosie.
Goodbye, Mae.
Call me Mrs. Peterson.
[Birdie opens a can of beer, which sprays on Mr. McAfee]
That's my favorite brand.
Save your life? Me? My friend, if you are sick, see a doctor.
"If you are sick, see a doctor." You speak English?
Saves time.
[after Kim has dyed her hair]
You dare defy your mother?
Well, it's my hair.
Not till you're 21!
Randolph, your father's warned you. If you make another bomb, you'll get spanked.
You know these adolescents! Kim'll lose face!
And if I don't get him out that's not all she'll...

[singing]
Kids! Never once appreciate how I sacrificed. Working, slaving, scrimping, saving pennies... and livin' with your father!
Now, don't try to pay me back, son. I forgive you. So what if you're an ingrate? So long as you're happy.
I don't wanna be happy!
This ballet has historic significance. It was performed the same day as the funeral of the Tzar. Lenin himself made the arrangement.
Lenin arranged music?
No, funerals.

[singing]
You don't know how to live? You'd get pinned if you could!
No matter how many millions I make selling Speed-Up, I'll still be the same humble, lovable guy I always was. And if any of those hicks try to push me around, I'll break 'em.
Nice? Heh HEH! I know that show business crowd - probably living in sin.
I respect ya, Papa!
I don't want your respect! Who wants respect from a ten-year-old kid?
Harry, do you have a cigarette? I've run out.
So have I, how 'bout my pipe?

[singing]
Everything is Rosie... cha-cha-cha! 'Cause my name is Rosie... si si si!
And for you, I will not go too fast.
We shall see!
Who sent you here, Senator Goldwater?
I got maybe one tenth a normal heart
Could you move over one, please...?
Tell me, Mrs. Peterson, what does your husband do?
I don't know, he's dead.

[after Albert hears his mother calling him]
Boy meets girl, boy looses girl, boy gets mother. Yeesh!
